title: Increasing the competence and confidence of Social Work researchers: building research capacity in social work
abstractText: This initiative addresses the need to develop the quantity and quality of methodological expertise in Social Work. It will provide opportunities to focus on research training and supervising postgraduate research students and will offer training in advanced methods for both students and academic staff. Workshops will be held on a regional basis to facilitate collaboration between universities. Each event will be subject to systematic evaluation. In addition material will be collected to develop infrastructures such as: websites; repositories of abstracts of doctoral theses and the potential will be explored for repositories for the materials presented in the workshops to be made available for wider use. The initiative is designed to enhance the quality of the evidence available to practitioners and policy makers and will positively influence the development of evidence based policy and practice in Social Work.
